similar: I don't feel like cooking, let's use an app.
How about some delivery for dinner?
Let's just stay in and order food.
I'm voting for a cozy night with pizza.
example:
A: What should we do for dinner tonight? Any ideas?
B: I'm exhausted. Let's just order in and watch a movie.
A: That sounds perfect. Mexican or Chinese?
B: Definitely Mexican. I could go for some tacos right now.
A: Done. I'll fire up the app and get it ordered.
B: You're a life saver. I'm not moving from this couch.
japanese: 出前（でまえ）取（と）ろう／デリバリーにしよう
chinese: 我们叫外卖吧 (Wǒmen jiào wàimài ba) / 订餐吧 (Dìngcān ba)
spanish: Pidamos algo de comer. / Pidamos a domicilio.

example:
A: *Achoo!*
B: Bless you.
A: Thanks, stupid allergies.
B: It is pollen season.
A: I hate spring.
B: Take some Claritin.
japanese: お大事（だいじ）に
chinese: 保重 (Bǎozhòng) (有人打喷嚏时说) / 长命百岁 (Chángmìngbǎisuì)
spanish: Salud. / Jesús.

similar: He doesn't really like the spotlight.
He's not one for big flashy displays.
example:
A: I'm nervous about meeting your brother today.
B: Don't be! He is very low-key. You'll like him.
A: Is he the type who talks a lot at first?
B: Not at all. He mostly just listens and cracks jokes.
A: Okay, that makes me feel much better.
B: Honestly, he's probably more nervous than you are.
japanese: 控（ひか）えめだね／地味（じみ）だけどいい人（ひと）
chinese: 他很低调 (Tā hěn dīdiào) / 他不张扬 (Tā bù zhāngyáng)
spanish: Él es muy tranquilo. / Él mantiene un perfil bajo.

similar: This place is incredible right now.
Wow, talk about a great vibe.
example:
A: Check out this light show! It's absolutely lit.
B: I know, right? This is the best concert ever!
A: Look at everyone's energy! It's contagious.
B: I'm so glad we decided to come tonight.
A: Same here, this is definitely going on my highlights.
B: For sure. Let's record a bit more before it ends.
japanese: 最高（さいこう）だね／盛（も）り上（あ）がってるね
chinese: 燃爆了 (Rán bào le) / 太嗨了 (Tài hāi le)
spanish: ¡Está increíble! / ¡Está que arde!

example:
A: Where did they go?
B: I have a hunch they're at the bar.
A: Why do you think that?
B: They mentioned happy hour.
A: Let's check it out.
B: If I'm right, you buy the first round.
japanese: 予感（よかん）がする／なんとなくそんな気（き）がする
chinese: 我有种预感 (Wǒ yǒu zhǒng yùgǎn) / 我觉得好像... (Wǒ juéde hǎoxiàng...)
spanish: Tengo una corazonada. / Me late que...

primary: It's on the tip of my tongue.
example:
A: Yo, what was that spot we hit last night?
B: It's on the tip of my tongue, for real.
A: Take your time, don't stress it.
B: Ah! It was that pizza joint in Brooklyn!
A: Facts, that place was fire.
B: Exactly, glad it finally clicked.
japanese: ここまで出（で）かかってるんだけど／なんだっけ、あれ
chinese: 就在嘴边 (Jiù zài zuǐbiān) / 一时想不起来 (Yìshí xiǎngbùqǐlái)
spanish: Lo tengo en la punta de la lengua. / Ya casi me acuerdo.

example:
A: Yo, what brings you here today?
B: Just checking out the new gallery.
A: Oh, word? I heard it's dope.
B: Definitely, you gotta see it.
A: I'll hit it up later then.
B: Bet, catch you later.
japanese: どうしたの？／何（なに）しに来（き）たの？／偶然（グウゼン）だね
chinese: 哪阵风把你吹来了？ (Nǎ zhèn fēng bǎ nǐ chuī lái le?) / 你来这儿干嘛？ (Nǐ lái zhèr gànmá?)
spanish: ¿Qué te trae por aquí? / ¿Qué haces aquí?

example:
A: You looking at my phone?
B: Relax, don't get any funny ideas.
A: Better not be.
B: I was just checking the time.
A: Good, keep it that way.
B: No cap, you're trippin'.
japanese: 変（へん）な気（き）を起（お）こさないで／勘違（かんちが）いしないで
chinese: 别想歪了 (Bié xiǎng wāi le) / 别打歪主意 (Bié dǎ wāi zhǔyi)
spanish: No te hagas ideas raras. / No malinterpretes las cosas.

primary: I'm not much of a coffee person.
similar: I'm more of a tea head.
example:
A: Yo, grab a latte with us?
B: Nah, I'm not much of a coffee person.
A: Really? How do you stay up?
B: I just vibe, you know?
A: Respect, I need my fix.
B: Go for it, enjoy.
japanese: コーヒーは苦（ニガ）手（て）なんだ／あんまり飲（の）まないんだ
chinese: 我不怎么喝咖啡 (Wǒ bù zěnme hē kāfēi) / 我对咖啡不太感冒 (Wǒ duì kāfēi bútài gǎnmào)
spanish: No soy muy cafetero. / No me gusta tanto el café.

example:
A: So we link at 8, then hit the jump.
B: Wait, I don't follow.
A: We meet at the spot first.
B: Oh, gotcha. My bad.
A: No worries, keep up.
B: I'm on it now.
japanese: 分（わ）からない／話（はなし）が見（み）えない
chinese: 我没听懂 (Wǒ méi tīngdǒng) / 我没跟上 (Wǒ méi gēnshàng)
spanish: No te sigo. / No entiendo lo que dices.

example:
A: Yo, are you wearing perfume?
B: Yeah, just a bit of that new drop.
A: It's fire, for real.
B: Thanks, glad you like it.
A: Where'd you cop it?
B: That boutique downtown.
japanese: 香水（こうすい）つけた？／いい匂（にお）いするね
chinese: 你喷香水了？ (Nǐ pēn xiāngshuǐ le?) / 你身上好香 (Nǐ shēnshàng hǎo xiāng)
spanish: ¿Te pusiste perfume? / ¿Hueles a perfume?

primary: We have bigger fish to fry.
similar: Keep the main thing the main thing.
example:
A: Should we worry about the leak?
B: Nah, we have bigger fish to fry.
A: Like the launch next week?
B: Exactly, keep your eyes on the prize.
A: Copy that, stay focused.
B: Facts, let's get it.
japanese: 他（ほか）に大事（だいじ）なことがある／優先（ゆうせん）すべきことがある
chinese: 我们有更重要的事要做 (Wǒmen yǒu gèng zhòngyào de shì yào zuò) / 还有大把正事呢 (Hái yǒu dàbǎ zhèngshì ne)
spanish: Tenemos cosas más importantes que hacer. / Tenemos asuntos más grandes que atender.

example:
A: Can you help with the files?
B: Sorry, I have my hands full.
A: All good, I'll ask Sam.
B: Appreciate the look, I'm stressed.
A: Take a breather when you can.
B: For sure, thanks.
japanese: 手（て）が離（はな）せない／手（て）一杯（いっぱい）なんだ
chinese: 我忙不过来 (Wǒ mángbuguòlái) / 我手头事儿太多 (Wǒ shǒutóu shìr tài duō)
spanish: Estoy ocupadísimo. / No doy abasto.

example:
A: They cancelled the show.
B: How can that be?
A: Budget cuts, apparently.
B: That's straight garbage.
A: Tell me about it.
B: I'm tight about this.
japanese: そんなバカな／どうしてそうなるの？
chinese: 怎么可能？ (Zěnme kěnéng?) / 哪有这种事？ (Nǎ yǒu zhèzhǒng shì?)
spanish: ¿Cómo puede ser? / ¿Cómo es posible?

similar: Six of one, half dozen of another.
example:
A: Is it a car or an SUV?
B: Potato, potahto at this point.
A: True, they both drive.
B: Exactly, don't overthink it.
A: Fair enough.
B: Word.
japanese: どっちも同（おな）じだよ／大差（たいさ）ないよ
chinese: 半斤八两 (Bànjīnbāliǎng) / 都差不多 (Dōu chàbuduō)
spanish: Da lo mismo. / Es la misma gata pero revolcada.

example:
A: Missed the train again?
B: Man, it's just not my day.
A: Chin up, it happens.
B: Just one thing after another.
A: Tomorrow's a new day.
B: For real, I need it.
japanese: 今日（きょう）はついてない／厄日（やくび）だ
chinese: 今天真不顺 (Jīntiān zhēn búshùn) / 今天倒霉透了 (Jīntiān dǎoméi tòu le)
spanish: No es mi día. / Hoy no doy una.

example:
A: You done with the project?
B: Far from it, man.
A: Still a lot left?
B: Yeah, like 80%.
A: Oof, good luck with that.
B: I'm gonna need it.
japanese: 全然（ぜんぜん）そんなことない／程遠（ほどとお）いよ
chinese: 差远了 (Chà yuǎn le) / 根本不是 (Gēnběn búshì)
spanish: Ni de lejos. / Nada que ver.

example:
A: Yo, fancy meeting you here!
B: I know, right? Wild.
A: What are you up to?
B: Just grabbing some groceries.
A: Word, me too.
B: Catch you around!
japanese: こんなところで会（あ）うなんて／奇遇（きぐう）だね
chinese: 真巧啊！ (Zhēn qiǎo a!) / 想不到在这儿碰见你！ (Xiǎngbúdào zài zhèr pèngjiàn nǐ!)
spanish: ¡Qué sorpresa verte aquí! / ¡Mira quién está aquí!

example:
A: We could just take the bus.
B: I never thought of that.
A: It's cheaper, for real.
B: Facts, let's do that.
A: Saved us some bread.
B: Good lookin' out.
japanese: その考（かんガ）えはなかった／思（おも）いつかなかった
chinese: 我从没想过那个 (Wǒ cóngméi xiǎngguò nàge) / 我没想到这一层 (Wǒ méi xiǎngdào zhè yì céng)
spanish: Nunca lo había pensado. / No se me había ocurrido.

primary: Are you gonna run some errands?
example:
A: Are you gonna run some errands?
B: Yeah, hitting the pharmacy and bank.
A: Can you grab some milk?
B: For sure, I got you.
A: Thanks, safe travels.
B: No doubt.
japanese: 用事（ようじ）済（す）ませてくる／買（か）い物（もの）してくる
chinese: 你要去办事吗？ (Nǐ yào qù bànshì ma?) / 你要去跑腿吗？ (Nǐ yào qù pǎotuǐ ma?)
spanish: ¿Vas a hacer mandados? / ¿Vas a salir a hacer cosas?

primary: I just did the best I could.
similar: Left it all on the court.
example:
A: How was the interview?
B: I just did the best I could.
A: That's all you can do.
B: Very true, hope it's enough.
A: Keep that head up.
B: Always.
japanese: 精一杯（せいいっぱい）やった／できることはやった
chinese: 我尽力了 (Wǒ jìnlì le) / 我能做的都做了 (Wǒ néng zuò de dōu zuò le)
spanish: Hice lo mejor que pude. / Di todo de mí.

example:
A: So, first I went to... then...
B: Yo, get to the point.
A: Fine, I lost my keys.
B: Finally, that took forever.
A: My bad, just explaining.
B: No need, just the facts.
japanese: 要点（ようてん）を言（い）って／結論（けつろん）は何（なに）？
chinese: 说重点 (Shuō zhòngdiǎn) / 捞干的说 (Lāo gān de shuō)
spanish: Ve al grano. / No te andes con rodeos.

primary: Do I have to spell it out for you?
example:
A: Why is she mad?
B: Do I have to spell it out for you?
A: I'm really lost.
B: You forgot her birthday, man!
A: Oh shoot, I'm toast.
B: Big facts.
japanese: 一（いち）から十（じゅう）まで言（い）わせる気（き）？／詳（くわ）しく説明（せつめい）しないとダメ？
chinese: 非要我画公仔画出肠吗？ (Fēiyào wǒ huà gōngzǎi huà chū cháng ma?) (广东话俗语，意为画得很详细) / 非要我把话挑明吗？(Fēiyào wǒ bǎ huà tiāomíng ma?)
spanish: ¿Te lo tengo que explicar con peras y manzanas? / ¿Quieres que te lo deletree?

primary: I can't get through to her.
example:
A: Did you talk to Jane?
B: I can't get through to her.
A: Still stubborn?
B: Worse than ever, honestly.
A: Just give it space.
B: Best move right now.
japanese: 話（はなし）が通（つう）じない／聞（き）く耳（みみ）持（も）たない
chinese: 我跟她讲不通 (Wǒ gēn tā jiǎngbùtōng) / 她听不进去 (Tā tīngbújìnqù)
spanish: No logro que me entienda. / No hay manera de convencerla.

example:
A: How much was this?
B: Take a wild guess.
A: Fifty bucks?
B: Try five hundred.
A: Are you serious?
B: No cap, it's designer.
japanese: 当（あ）ててみて／適当（てきとう）に言（い）ってみて
chinese: 瞎猜一个 (Xiā cāi yí gè) / 随便猜猜 (Suíbiàn cāicai)
spanish: Adivina. / Echa un cálculo.

example:
A: I might go, depends...
B: Yo, no more wishy-washy.
A: Fine, I'm in.
B: Good, stay firm on that.
A: Will do.
B: Bet.
japanese: 優柔不断（ゆうじゅうふだん）はやめて／ハッキリして
chinese: 别再优柔寡断了 (Bié zài yōuróuguǎduàn le) / 别磨叽了 (Bié móji le)
spanish: Ya no seas indeciso. / Decídete de una vez.

example:
A: You took my sandwich!
B: Sue me, I was hungry.
A: That's messed up.
B: I'll buy you another one.
A: Better be fire.
B: No doubt.
japanese: 訴（うった）えれば？／文句（もんく）ある？
chinese: 你去告我啊！ (Nǐ qù gào wǒ a!) / 咬我啊！ (Yǎo wǒ a!)
spanish: ¡Pues demándame! / ¿Y qué?

example:
A: Are you guys arguing?
B: Nah, just making chit chat.
A: Oh, looked intense.
B: Just talking about movies.
A: Oh, cool.
B: All good.
japanese: 雑談（ざつだん）してただけ／おしゃべりしてただけ
chinese: 只是闲聊 (Zhǐshì xiánliáo) / 随便聊聊 (Suíbiàn liáoliao)
spanish: Solo platicando. / Solo charlando un poco.

example:
A: Did you see the game?
B: Yeah, we won by a nose.
A: That last play was wild.
B: Heart was pounding, for real.
A: Glad we pulled through.
B: Same here.
japanese: 僅差（きんさ）で勝（か）った／ギリギリ勝（か）った
chinese: 我们险胜 (Wǒmen xiǎnshèng) / 赢了一点点 (Yíng le yìdiǎndiǎn)
spanish: Ganamos por un pelo. / Ganamos de milagro.

example:
A: I forgot the tickets.
B: Well, that's on you.
A: Help me find them!
B: I told you to pack them yesterday.
A: I know, my bad.
B: Find 'em quick.
japanese: 自業自得（じごうじとく）だよ／君（きみ）の責任（せきにん）だ
chinese: 这得怪你 (Zhè děi guài nǐ) / 是你的锅 (Shì nǐ de guō)
spanish: Eso es cosa tuya. / Es tu responsabilidad.

example:
A: Wanna run 5k?
B: Man, I'm totally out of shape.
A: Start slow then.
B: I'll try walk-jogging.
A: Every bit counts.
B: Facts.
japanese: なまってる／運動不足（うんどうぶそく）だ
chinese: 我身材走样了 (Wǒ shēncái zǒuyàng le) / 我体能废了 (Wǒ tǐnéng fèi le)
spanish: Estoy totalmente fuera de forma. / Estoy oxidado.

example:
A: Yo, why are you dressed up?
B: Got a date later.
A: Ah, looking sharp.
B: Thanks, trying this new look.
A: It's working, for real.
B: Appreciate it.
japanese: どうしたのその格好（かっこう）？／今日（きょう）はおめかし？
chinese: 你怎么穿这么正式？ (Nǐ zěnme chuān zhème zhèngshì?) / 穿这么帅干嘛？ (Chuān zhème shuài gànmá?)
spanish: ¿Por qué tan elegante? / ¿A dónde vas tan guapo?

primary: I bought it for a song.
example:
A: Love that jacket.
B: I bought it for a song at the thrift.
A: No way, how much?
B: Ten bucks.
A: That's a huge W.
B: I know, right?
japanese: 激安（げきやす）だった／二束三文（にそくさんもん）で買（か）った
chinese: 我超低价买的 (Wǒ chāo dījià mǎi de) / 捡了个大便宜 (Jiǎn le gè dà piányi)
spanish: Lo compré regalado. / Me costó una nada.

example:
A: Did you see that car?
B: Man, that was a close call!
A: Almost hit us.
B: Heart's racing right now.
A: Let's be careful.
B: For real.
japanese: 危（あぶ）なかった／間一髪（かんいっぱつ）だった
chinese: 好险！ (Hǎo xiǎn!) / 差点就要命了！ (Chàdiǎn jiù yàomìng le!)
spanish: ¡Estuvo cerca! / ¡Nos salvamos de milagro!

example:
A: Nice meeting you.
B: Likewise.
A: Hope we link up again.
B: Def, for sure.
A: Stay safe.
B: You too.
japanese: こちらこそ／私（わたし）も
chinese: 彼此彼此 (Bǐcǐbǐcǐ) / 你也一样 (Nǐ yě yíyàng)
spanish: Igualmente. / Lo mismo digo.

example:
A: I got you that coffee you like.
B: Aw, you made my day!
A: Just a little something.
B: Seriously, I was struggling.
A: Anytime, friend.
B: Best ever.
japanese: おかげでいい日（ひ）になった／嬉（うれ）しいよ
chinese: 你让我太开心了 (Nǐ ràng wǒ tài kāixīn le) / 有你真好 (Yǒu nǐ zhēn hǎo)
spanish: Me alegraste el día. / Me hiciste el día.

example:
A: You know Mike too?
B: Yeah, we went to school together.
A: What a small world!
B: Right? He's everywhere.
A: Crazy odds.
B: For real.
japanese: 世間（せけん）は狭（せま）いね
chinese: 世界真小啊 (Shìjiè zhēn xiǎo a) /这也太巧了 (Zhè yě tài qiǎo le)
spanish: El mundo es un pañuelo. / Qué pequeño es el mundo.

example:
A: They teamed up together.
B: I didn't see this coming.
A: Me neither, total shock.
B: Could be dope though.
A: We'll see.
B: Facts.
japanese: 予想外（よそうがい）だった／まさかこうなるとは
chinese: 我没想到会这样 (Wǒ méi xiǎngdào huì zhèyàng) / 这太意外了 (Zhè tài yìwài le)
spanish: No me lo esperaba. / Esto sí que no lo vi venir.

example:
A: Can I come in?
B: Yeah, sorry about the mess.
A: No worries, mine's worse.
B: Just haven't had time.
A: I feel you.
B: Thanks for understanding.
japanese: 散（ち）らかっててごめん／汚（きたな）くてごめん
chinese: 抱歉这就么乱 (Bàoqiàn zhè jiù me luàn) / 没收拾，见笑了 (Méi shōushi, jiànxiào le)
spanish: Perdón por el desorden. / Disculpa el tiradero.

example:
A: I heard about your project.
B: Really? Everyone speaks highly of you too.
A: Oh, stop it.
B: No cap, you're doing big things.
A: I'm trying.
B: Keep it up.
japanese: みんな君（きみ）のこと褒（ほ）めてたよ／評判（ひょうばん）いいよ
chinese: 大家都夸你 (Dàjiā dōu kuā nǐ) / 你的口碑很好 (Nǐ de kǒubēi hěn hǎo)
spanish: Todos hablan maravillas de ti. / Tienes muy buena fama.

primary: You have to put yourself in my shoes.
similar: Walk a mile in my path.
example:
A: Why are you being so tough?
B: You have to put yourself in my shoes.
A: I guess it is stressful.
B: Exactly, I'm just looking out.
A: I get it now.
B: Thanks.
japanese: 私（わたし）の立場（たちば）になって考（かんガ）えて
chinese: 你得设身处地为我想想 (Nǐ děi shèshēnchǔdì wèi wǒ xiǎngxiang) / 你站我角度看看 (Nǐ zhàn wǒ jiǎodù kànkan)
spanish: Ponte en mis zapatos. / Ponte en mi lugar.

example:
A: Yo, where have you been?
B: Just busy with life, you know.
A: Haven't seen you at the spot.
B: Yeah, I've been low key.
A: Well, glad you're back.
B: Same.
japanese: どこ行ってたの？／久（ひさ）しぶりだね
chinese: 你死哪儿去了？ (Nǐ sǐ nǎr qù le?) / 好久不见，去哪了？ (Hǎojiǔ bújiàn, qù nǎ le?)
spanish: ¿Dónde te habías metido? / ¿Dónde has estado?

example:
A: I'm moving out tomorrow.
B: Dang, don't be a stranger.
A: Of course not, I'll call.
B: Better see you around.
A: For sure, take care.
B: You too.
japanese: 連絡（れんらく）してね／また会（あ）おうね
chinese: 别不联系啊 (Bié bù liánxì a) / 常联系 (Cháng liánxì)
spanish: No te pierdas. / Mantente en contacto.

example:
A: Can I return this later?
B: Sorry, all sales are final.
A: Even if it's broken?
B: Check it before you buy.
A: Harsh rules.
B: Store policy, man.
japanese: 返品（へんぴん）不可（ふか）です／交換（こうかん）できません
chinese: 售出不退 (Shòuchū bú tuì) / 离柜概不负责 (Lí guì gàibùfùzé)
spanish: No se aceptan devoluciones. / Las ventas son finales.

example:
A: You spilled my drink!
B: I never meant to, my bad.
A: It's all over my shoes.
B: I'll get some napkins.
A: Hurry up, please.
B: On it.
japanese: わざとじゃないんだ／そんなつもりじゃなかった
chinese: 我不是故意的 (Wǒ búshì gùyì de) / 我没那个意思 (Wǒ méi nàge yìsi)
spanish: No fue mi intención. / No quise hacerlo.

example:
A: So how do we split the rent?
B: Here's the deal, I pay 60, you pay 40.
A: Why do the math like that?
B: I got the bigger room, facts.
A: Fair enough, I'm down.
B: Bet, let's sign it.
japanese: こうしよう／条件（じょうけん）はこうだ
chinese: 情况是这样的 (Qíngkuàng shì zhèyàng de) / 咱们这么着 (Zánmen zhème zhe)
spanish: El trato es este. / Así está la cosa.

example:
A: And then he said that his dog...
B: Yo, enough chit chat. We gotta work.
A: My bad, just a quick story.
B: We're on a deadline, focus up.
A: Copy that, back to the code.
B: Good lookin'.
japanese: 無駄話（むだばなし）はここまで／おしゃべりは終（お）わり
chinese: 闲话少说 (Xiánhuà shǎoshuō) / 言归正传 (Yánguīzhèngzhuàn)
spanish: Basta de charla. / Menos plática y más acción.

example:
A: The project is due in an hour.
B: We can pull this off, trust me.
A: You really think so?
B: We just gotta grind it out.
A: Let's get it then.
B: Full steam ahead.
japanese: うまくいくよ／なんとかなるよ
chinese: 我们可以搞定的 (Wǒmen kěyǐ gǎodìng de) / 这事能成 (Zhè shì néng chéng)
spanish: Podemos lograrlo. / Podemos sacar esto adelante.

example:
A: You're gonna pay me back, right?
B: You have my word, next Friday.
A: Better not be ghosting me.
B: No cap, I got you.
A: Alright, I'll hold you to it.
B: No doubt.
japanese: 約束（やくそく）する／誓（ちか）うよ
chinese: 我向你保证 (Wǒ xiàng nǐ bǎozhèng) / 我说话算话 (Wǒ shuōhuà suànhuà)
spanish: Te doy mi palabra. / Te lo prometo.

example:
A: Can I just add one more thing?
B: Sorry, time's up.
A: Just a second!
B: Rule is a rule, man.
A: Dang, I was so close.
B: Maybe next time.
japanese: 時間（じかん）切（ぎ）れ／そこまで
chinese: 时间到 (Shíjiān dào) / 没时间了 (Méi shíjiān le)
spanish: Se acabó el tiempo. / Tiempo fuera.

primary: Do I know you from somewhere?
example:
A: Do I know you from somewhere?
B: Maybe at that party last week?
A: Ah, that's it! In the Bronx.
B: Yeah, I was by the DJ booth.
A: Crazy coincidence.
B: For real though.
japanese: どこかでお会（あ）いしましたっけ？／知（し）り合（あ）いでしたっけ？
chinese: 我看你很面熟 (Wǒ kàn nǐ hěn miànshú) / 我们是不是在哪儿见过？ (Wǒmen shìbushì zài nǎr jiànguo?)
spanish: Es pan comido. / Está facilísimo.

primary: Fake it till you make it.
example:
A: I'm nervous about the presentation.
B: Just fake it till you make it, man.
A: What if they see through me?
B: Confidence is key, just vibe.
A: Alright, I'll try my best.
B: You got this, no cap.
japanese: できるフリしてればなんとかなる／ハッタリも実力（じつりょく）のうち
chinese: 装也要装得像一点 (Zhuāng yě yào zhuāng de xiàng yìdiǎn) / 先假装行，最后就真行了 (Xiān jiǎzhuāng xíng, zuìhòu jiù zhēn xíng le)
spanish: Me quedé en blanco. / Se me fue la onda.

example:
A: Why didn't I get the promotion?
B: Don't take it personally, it was budget.
A: Still feels bad though.
B: I get it, but your time is coming.
A: Thanks for the talk.
B: Anytime, keep grinding.
japanese: 悪気（わるぎ）はないんだ／気（き）にしないで
chinese: 别往心里去 (Bié wǎng xīnli qù) / 别太在意 (Bié tài zàiyì)
spanish: Te debo una. / Estoy en deuda contigo.

example:
A: Why is the subway always late?
B: That's the way it is in NYC.
A: It's so frustrating though.
B: You get used to it, eventually.
A: I guess so.
B: Facts.
japanese: そういうものだよ／仕方（しかた）ないよ
chinese: 现实就是这样 (Xiànshí jiùshì zhèyàng) / 命就这样 (Mìng jiù zhèyàng)
spanish: No me cuadra. / Algo no encaja.

example:
A: I think I can jump that gap.
B: Don't be ridiculous, you'll fall.
A: I'm fast though!
B: Not that fast, stay safe.
A: Fine, I'll walk around.
B: Smart move.
japanese: バカなこと言（い）わないで／ふざけないで
chinese: 别犯傻了 (Bié fànshǎ le) / 别荒唐了 (Bié huāngtáng le)
spanish: Vamos a medias. / Pagamos mitad y mitad.

example:
A: Why so sad, man?
B: I got dumped last night.
A: No way, what happened?
B: She said it just wasn't working.
A: Tough break, let's grab a drink.
B: I need it, for real.
japanese: 振（ふ）られた／彼女（かのじょ）に捨（す）てられた
chinese: 我被甩了 (Wǒ bèi shuǎi le) / 我失恋了 (Wǒ shīliàn le)
spanish: Me estás tomando el pelo. / Me estás bromeando.

example:
A: He didn't come because he was sick.
B: Ah, now it makes sense.
A: Yeah, he was feeling rough.
B: Well, I hope he gets better.
A: Same here.
B: No doubt.
japanese: それで納得（なっとく）／合点（がてん）がいった
chinese: 这下说得通了 (Zhèxià shuōdetōng le) / 原来如此 (Yuánláirúcǐ)
spanish: Mantén la cabeza en alto. / No te desanimes.

example:
A: Are you ready for the meeting?
B: Let's get it over with, honestly.
A: Nervous?
B: Just want to be done.
A: I feel you, let's go.
B: Bet.
japanese: さっさと済（す）ませよう／早（はや）く終わらせよう
chinese: 速战速决吧 (Sùzhànsùjué ba) / 赶紧完事吧 (Gǎnjǐn wánshì ba)
spanish: Es ahora o nunca. / No hay otra oportunidad.

example:
A: The concert got rained out.
B: What a shame, I was hyped.
A: Me too, bought the outfit and all.
B: Hopefully they reschedule.
A: Better be soon.
B: For real.
japanese: 残念（ざんねん）だね／もったいないね
chinese: 真遗憾 (Zhēn yíhàn) / 太可惜了 (Tài kěxī le)
spanish: Déjalo ya. / Olvídalo.

example:
A: She keeps texting me every hour.
B: Bro, she's obsessed with you.
A: It's starting to get creepy.
B: You gotta set some boundaries.
A: Facts, I will today.
B: Good luck with that.
japanese: 君（きみ）に夢中（むちゅう）だね／君（きみ）しか見（み）えてないね
chinese: 她迷上你了 (Tā míshàng nǐ le) / 她对你着魔了 (Tā duì nǐ zháomó le)
spanish: Estoy harto. / Ya me cansé.

example:
A: So the plan is to link at 9.
B: Wait, what about the car?
A: Are you with me? I said take the bus.
B: Oh, my bad. I'm on it now.
A: Focus up, we're moving.
B: Bet.
japanese: 聞（き）いてる？／理解（りかい）できた？
chinese: 你听懂了吗？ (Nǐ tīngdǒng le ma?) / 这个能理解吗？ (Zhège néng lǐjiě ma?)
spanish: No tiene sentido. / Es ilógico.

example:
A: Why are you being so loud?
B: Mind your business, man.
A: Just asking, relax.
B: Well, keep your head out of it.
A: Alright, chill.
B: Good.
japanese: 余計（よけい）なお世話（せわ）だ／関係（かんけい）ないでしょ
chinese: 少管闲事 (Shǎo guǎn xiánshì) / 没你事儿 (Méi nǐ shìr)
spanish: Piénsalo bien. / Medítalo antes de actuar.

example:
A: You were really mad earlier.
B: Yeah, I overreacted. Sorry about that.
A: All good, we all have those days.
B: I was just stressed, no cap.
A: Reset and vibe on.
B: For sure.
japanese: 大（おお）げさだった／取（と）り乱（みだ）しちゃった
chinese: 我反应过激了 (Wǒ fǎnyìng guòjī le) / 我太激动了 (Wǒ tài jīdòng le)
spanish: Es un secreto a voces. / Todo el mundo lo sabe.

primary: I have nothing to do with that.
example:
A: Did you tell her about the secret?
B: I have nothing to do with that.
A: Then who did?
B: Probably Sam, he's always talking.
A: I'll check with him then.
B: Do that, keep me out.
japanese: 私（わたし）には関係（かんけい）ない／知（し）ったことじゃない
chinese: 这跟我没关系 (Zhè gēn wǒ méi guāxì) / 我跟这事儿不沾边 (Wǒ gēn zhè shìr bù zhānbiān)
spanish: No me malinterpretes. / No me tomes a mal.

example:
A: Wanna hit the club tonight?
B: I think I'll pass, I'm tired.
A: Come on, it'll be lit!
B: Nah, I need my 8 hours.
A: Your loss, see ya.
B: Have fun, peace.
japanese: やめとくよ／パスするよ
chinese: 我还是算了吧 (Wǒ háishì suànle ba) / 我就不参与了 (Wǒ jiù bù cānyù le)
spanish: Estoy sin blanca. / No tengo ni un quinto.

example:
A: Why is my bill so high?
B: There's been a big mistake, let me check.
A: Better fix it quick.
B: Appears we overcharged you, sorry.
A: Appreciate the fast catch.
B: No worries, fixed now.
japanese: 大（だい）失敗（しっぱい）だった／間違（まちが）いだった
chinese: 搞错了 (Gǎo cuò le) / 出了个大乌龙 (Chū le gè dà wūlóng)
spanish: A otro perro con ese hueso. / No te creo nada.

example:
A: You look stressed, you okay?
B: I gotta get some air, honestly.
A: Want me to come with?
B: Nah, I just need a minute alone.
A: Cool, take your time.
B: Thanks.
japanese: 外（そと）の空気（くうき）吸（す）ってくる／頭（あたま）冷（ひ）やしてくる
chinese: 我得透透气 (Wǒ děi tòutouqì) / 我出去吸口氧 (Wǒ chūqù xī kǒu yǎng)
spanish: Más claro, ni el agua. / Está clarísimo.

primary: Okay if we take a rain check?
example:
A: Still on for dinner?
B: Okay if we take a rain check? Something came up.
A: Sure, another time then.
B: Appreciate you being chill about it.
A: No sweat, catch you later.
B: Bet.
japanese: また今度（こんど）でもいい？／延期（えんき）してもいい？
chinese: 改天行吗？ (Gǎitiān xíng ma?) / 下次吧好吗？ (Xiàcì ba hǎoma?)
spanish: Se me pegaron las sábanas. / Me quedé dormido.

example:
A: He said he'd call me back.
B: Don't hold your breath, he's flakier than a croissant.
A: That's harsh.
B: Just keeping it real with you.
A: I'll try not to worry then.
B: Smart move.
japanese: 期待（きたい）しない方（ほう）がいいよ／当（あ）てにしない方がいい
chinese: 别抱太大希望 (Bié bào tài dà xīwàng) / 别指望了 (Bié zhǐwàng le)
spanish: Me importa un bledo. / Me da igual.

similar: I don't know him like that.
example:
A: Are you both together?
B: Nah, he's not with me.
A: Oh, sorry. Thought you were friends.
B: Easy mistake, no worries.
A: Have a good one.
B: You too.
japanese: 連（つ）れじゃないです／関係（かんけい）ない人（ひと）です
chinese: 他不跟我一起 (Tā bù gēn wǒ yìqǐ) / 我跟他不是一伙的 (Wǒ gēn tā búshì yìhuǒ de)
spanish: No hay mal que por bien no venga. / Todo pasa por algo.

example:
A: What's wrong now?
B: First my phone, now my car. I can't catch a break.
A: That's tough, man.
B: Tells me the universe is buggin'.
A: Take a breather, it'll pass.
B: Hope so.
japanese: 全然（ぜんぜん）ついてない／踏（ふ）んだり蹴（け）ったりだ
chinese: 我最近太背了 (Wǒ zuìjìn tài bèi le) / 倒霉事都赶一起了 (Dǎoméi shì dōu gǎn yìqǐ le)
spanish: Tirar la toalla. / Rindirse.

example:
A: Yo, do me a favor and watch my bag?
B: Sure, for how long?
A: Just five minutes, gotta hit the restroom.
B: I got you, no worries.
A: Appreciate the solid.
B: Bet.
japanese: お願（ねが）いがあるんだけど／手（て）を貸（か）して
chinese: 帮我个忙 (Bāng wǒ gè máng) / 搭把手 (Dā bǎ shǒu)
spanish: Hacer de tripas corazón. / Sacar fuerzas de flaqueza.

example:
A: They actually broke up.
B: I knew it, they were arguing all week.
A: Sad though, they were cute.
B: Sometimes it's for the best.
A: True that.
B: No cap.
japanese: やっぱりね／そう来（く）ると思（おも）った
chinese: 我就知道 (Wǒ jiù zhīdào) / 果然不出我所料 (Guǒrán bù chū wǒ suǒliào)
spanish: Empezar con el pie derecho. / Empezar bien.

similar: My bad, forget I said it.
example:
A: You said I was lazy!
B: Fine, I take it back. You're working hard.
A: Thanks, finally some credit.
B: I was just frustrated earlier.
A: Accepted apology.
B: Word.
japanese: 取（と）り消（け）すよ／今のなし
chinese: 我收回那句话 (Wǒ shōuhuí nà jù huà) / 当我没说 (Dāng wǒ méi shuō)
spanish: Costar un ojo de la cara. / Ser carísimo.

example:
A & B: Pizza tonight!
A: Jinx! You owe me a soda.
B: No way, we said it together!
A: Rule of the game, pay up.
B: Fine, I'll get the drinks.
A: Victory!
japanese: ハモった！／かぶった！
chinese: 心有灵犀！ (Xīnyǒulíngxī!) / 咱俩想到一块去了！ (Zánliǎ xiǎngdào yíkuài qù le!) (Also: Jinx = 乌鸦嘴 wūyāzuǐ if modifying bad luck, but here it's 'simultaneous speech game')
spanish: Estar en las nubes. / Estar distraído.

example:
A: Does money make you happy?
B: Not necessarily, peace of mind is bigger.
A: Good point, some rich folks are sad.
B: Exactly, vibes matter most.
A: Facts.
B: Straight up.
japanese: 必（かなら）ずしもそうじゃない／そうとは限（かぎ）らない
chinese: 那倒未必 (Nà dào wèibì) / 不见得 (Bújiànde)
spanish: Dar en el blanco. / Acertar.

example:
A: Is the dinner ready yet?
B: Ta-da! Freshly made pasta.
A: Wow, looks amazing!
B: Dig in while it's hot.
A: You really outdid yourself.
B: Enjoy, my friend.
japanese: ジャジャーン！／完成（かんせい）！
chinese: 当当当当！ (Dāngdāngdāngdāng!) / 看这里！ (Kàn zhèlǐ!)
spanish: Ser pan comido. / Ser muy fácil.

example:
A: I think we should focus on marketing.
B: We're on the same page, I was just saying that.
A: Great, let's start the campaign then.
B: No doubt, let's get it.
A: Solid plan.
B: Bet.
japanese: 意見（いけん）が一致（いっち）してるね／同感（どうかん）だよ
chinese: 我们想到一块儿去了 (Wǒmen xiǎngdào yíkuàir qù le) / 自解是一致的 (Zìjiě shì yízhì de)
spanish: Tomar el toro por los cuernos. / Afrontar el problema.

example:
A: Should we hire him?
B: I like his portfolio. What do you say?
A: I'm down if you are.
B: Let's give him a shot then.
A: Sounds good to me.
B: Great.
japanese: どう？／どう思（おも）う？
chinese: 你怎么看？ (Nǐ zěnme kàn?) / 你觉得呢？ (Nǐ juéde ne?)
spanish: Estar entre la espada y la pared. / Estar en un dilema.

primary: I warned you this would happen.
meaning: 이런 일이 일어날 거라고 내가 경고 했잖아.
example:
A: My phone broke after dropping it in the lake.
B: I warned you this would happen, man.
A: I thought it was waterproof!
B: Clearly not. Now you need a new one.
A: My wallet is crying.
B: Lessons learned.
japanese: 言（い）った通りでしょ／だから言（い）ったのに
chinese: 我早告诉过你会这样的 (Wǒ zǎo gàosu guò nǐ huì zhèyàng de) / 我早就警告过你 (Wǒ zǎojiù jǐnggào guò nǐ)
spanish: Darle la vuelta a la tortilla. / Cambiar la situación.

example:
A: Still mad about the argument?
B: Nah, it's water under the bridge now.
A: Glad to hear that, I felt bad.
B: No worries, we're good.
A: Awesome.
B: Vibes.
japanese: 済（す）んだことだよ／昔（むかし）の話（はなし）だよ
chinese: 都过去了 (Dōu guòqù le) / 往事别再提了 (Wǎngshì bié zài tí le)
spanish: No todo lo que brilla es oro. / Las apariencias engañan.

example:
A: How much will the renovation cost?
B: I have a ballpark figure, around 5k.
A: Is that including materials?
B: Yeah, give or take a few.
A: Alright, good to know.
B: No prob.
japanese: ざっくりした数字（すうじ）／概算（がいさん）
chinese: 我有个大概的数 (Wǒ yǒu gè dàgài de shù) / 心里有个底 (Xīnli yǒu gè dǐ)
spanish: Matar dos pájaros de un tiro. / Hacer dos cosas a la vez.

example:
A: I messed up the presentation.
B: Don't beat yourself up, you'll nail it next time.
A: I just feel so stupid.
B: Everyone slips up, just keep pushing.
A: Thanks for the pep talk.
B: Anytime.
japanese: 自分（じぶん）を責（せ）めないで／落（お）ち込（こ）まないで
chinese: 别自责了 (Bié zìzé le) / 别跟自己过不去 (Bié gēn zìjǐ guòbùqù)
spanish: Más vale tarde que nunca. / Mejor tarde.

example:
A: Why'd you guys break up?
B: He cheated on me with his ex.
A: No way, that's low.
B: I deserve better, honestly.
A: 100%, you're a queen.
B: Thanks for the support.
japanese: 浮気（うわき）された／裏切（うらぎ）られた
chinese: 他劈腿了 (Tā pītuǐ le) / 他出轨了 (Tā chūguǐ le)
spanish: En boca cerrada no entran moscas. / Mejor quedarse callado.

example:
A: Did you finish the report?
B: No, and the meeting is in five minutes. I'm so screwed.
A: Want me to help you stall?
B: Please, that would be a lifesaver.
A: Leave it to me.
B: You're the best.
japanese: 最悪（さいあく）だ／終（お）わった
chinese: 我死定了 (Wǒ sǐdìng le) / 我完蛋了 (Wǒ wándàn le)
spanish: Camarón que se duerme se lo lleva la corriente. / Si te descuidas, pierdes.

example:
A: My life is over because of this pimple!
B: Yo, you're being so dramatic.
A: But it's huge!
B: Nobody even noticed until you said something.
A: Fine, maybe I'm overreacting.
B: Facts.
japanese: 大（おお）げさだよ／悲劇（ひげき）のヒロインぶらないで
chinese: 你也太戏精了 (Nǐ yě tài xìjīng le) / 别那么夸张 (Bié nàme kuāzhāng)
spanish: A caballo regalado no se le mira el diente. / Acepta los regalos sin quejarte.

example:
A: I think I can beat the pro at chess.
B: Trust me, you're out of your league.
A: I've been practicing though!
B: He's a grandmaster, man. Relax.
A: Fair point.
B: Stick to the amateurs.
japanese: 高嶺（たかね）の花（はな）だよ／相手（あいて）にされないよ／レベルが違（ちが）う
chinese: 你高攀不起 (Nǐ gāopānbùqǐ) / 这不是你能驾驭的 (Zhè búshì nǐ néng jiàyù de)
spanish: Quien mucho abarca poco aprieta. / No trates de hacer todo a la vez.

example:
A: The test results came back negative.
B: Oh man, I'm so relieved.
A: Me too, I was worried sick.
B: Thanks for being there with me.
A: Always, no doubt.
B: Let's celebrate.
japanese: 安心（あんしん）した／ホッとした
chinese: 我总算放心了 (Wǒ zǒngsuàn fàngxīn le) / 心里石头落地了 (Xīnli shítou luòdì le)
spanish: Dime con quién andas y te diré quién eres. / Las compañías definen quién eres.

example:
A: Do you think Mark likes me?
B: Girl, he's crazy about you.
A: Really? He's so shy though.
B: Have you seen how he looks at you? No cap.
A: Maybe I should talk to him.
B: Do it, he's waiting.
japanese: 君（きみ）に首（くび）ったけだね／ゾッコンだね
chinese: 他对你着迷了 (Tā duì nǐ zháomí le) / 他超级喜欢你 (Tā chāojí xǐhuan nǐ)
spanish: Ojos que no ven, corazón que no siente. / Si no lo veo, no me duele.

example:
A: Yo, how are we on time?
B: We've got about ten minutes left.
A: Perfect, enough to finish this up.
B: Hurry though, don't slack.
A: On it, for real.
B: Bet.
japanese: 時間（じかん）どう？／遅（おく）れてない？
chinese: 时间来得及吗？ (Shíjiān láidejí ma?) / 我们赶趟吗？ (Wǒmen gǎntàng ma?)
spanish: Perro que ladra no muerde. / Mucho ruido y pocas nueces.

primary: Don't try to butter me up.
similar: No need for the sweet talk.
example:
A: You look so fit today! Did you hit the gym?
B: Don't try to butter me up. What do you want?
A: Can I borrow twenty bucks?
B: I knew it was coming! Nope.
A: Worth a shot though.
B: Nice try.
japanese: お世辞（せじ）はいいよ／ゴマすらないで
chinese: 别拍马屁 (Bié pāimǎpì) / 少来这套 (Shǎo lái zhè tào)
spanish: El que ríe al último, ríe mejor. / La victoria final es la que cuenta.

primary: I do have feelings for you.
similar: Got a soft spot for you.
example:
A: I wasn't sure if you felt the same way.
B: I do have feelings for you, honestly.
A: Really? I'm so happy to hear that.
B: Just didn't know how to say it.
A: Glad you did now.
B: Me too, no cap.
japanese: 気（き）があるんだ／好（す）きなんだ
chinese: 我对你是有感觉的 (Wǒ duì nǐ shì yǒu gǎnjué de) / 我确实喜欢你 (Wǒ quèshí xǐhuan nǐ)
spanish: Hierba mala nunca muere. / Los malos siempre duran.

example:
A: I'll be there in like five minutes.
B: Don't keep me waiting, I'm already here.
A: Just grabbing my keys now.
B: Be quick if you want to catch the show.
A: On my way!
B: Better be.
japanese: 待（ま）たせないで／早（はや）くして
chinese: 别让我久等 (Bié ràng wǒ jiǔděng) / 快点儿 (Kuàidiǎnr)
spanish: Al mal tiempo, buena cara. / Sé positivo ante los problemas.

primary: You guys are so made for each other.
example:
A: I think we're going to get married.
B: You guys are so made for each other, honestly.
A: Thanks, it feels right.
B: Everyone sees it, no cap.
A: Appreciate the love.
B: Always.
japanese: お似合（にあ）いだね／ベストカップルだね
chinese: 你们俩太般配了 (Nǐmen liǎ tài bānpèi le) / 天生一对 (Tiānshēng yí duì)
spanish: No hay peor sordo que el que no quiere oír. / Es inútil hablar con quien no quiere escuchar.

example:
A: I'm not going to the party after all.
B: Suit yourself, but you're missing out.
A: I just need some alone time.
B: All good, enjoy the peace.
A: See ya tomorrow.
B: Peace.
japanese: 勝手（かって）にすれば／好（す）きにすれば
chinese: 随你便 (Suí nǐ biàn) / 爱咋咋地 (Ài zǎzǎdì)
spanish: Cría cuervos y te sacarán los ojos. / La ingratitud duele.

example:
A: Should I add more salt?
B: Nah, that should do it.
A: You sure? I want it fire.
B: Trust me, it's perfect now.
A: Alright, serving it up.
B: Let's eat!
japanese: これで十分（じゅうぶん）／これでOK
chinese: 这样就行了 (Zhèyàng jiù xíng le) / 差不多了 (Chàbuduō le)
spanish: Del dicho al hecho hay mucho trecho. / Decir es fácil, hacer es difícil.

similar: Be back in a sec, freshening up.
example:
A: Dinner is in twenty minutes.
B: Perfect, I'm gonna go freshen up.
A: Take your time, don't rush.
B: Be back out in ten.
A: Alright, cool.
B: Bet.
japanese: リフレッシュしてくる／化粧（けしょう）直（なお）してくる／シャワー浴（あ）びてくる
chinese: 我去洗漱一下 (Wǒ qù xǐshù yíxià) / 我去补个妆 (Wǒ qù bǔ gè zhuāng)
spanish: El hábito no hace al monje. / La ropa no define a la persona.

example:
A: How do I look in this shirt?
B: Uh, you're wearing it backwards.
A: No way! Are you serious?
B: Yeah, the tag is right there on your neck.
A: Oh shoot, my bad.
B: Hilarious, honestly.
japanese: 後（うし）ろ前（まえ）だよ／反対（はんたい）だよ
chinese: 你穿反了 (Nǐ chuān fǎn le) (inside out/backwards generic) / 前后穿反了 (Qiánhòu chuān fǎn le)
spanish: Aunque la mona se vista de seda, mona se queda. / No se puede ocultar lo que uno es.

primary: Will you be home for dinner?
example:
A: Will you be home for dinner?
B: Yeah, I'll be back around 7.
A: Great, I'm making lasagna.
B: Fire! Can't wait.
A: See you then.
B: Bet.
japanese: 夕飯（ゆうはん）家（いえ）で食（た）べる？／ご飯（はん）どうする？
chinese: 你回家吃晚饭吗？ (Nǐ huíjiā chī wǎnfàn ma?) / 晚上回来吃吗？ (Wǎnshang huílái chī ma?)
spanish: Más sabe el diablo por viejo que por diablo. / La experiencia vale más.

primary: I'm afraid we're out of stock.
example:
A: Do you have these sneakers in size 10?
B: I'm afraid we're out of stock until next week.
A: Dang, I really wanted these.
B: Try the branch downtown, they might have 'em.
A: Good idea, thanks.
B: No prob.
japanese: 在庫（ざいこ）切（ぎ）れです／売（う）り切（き）れです
chinese: 恐怕没货了 (Kǒngpà méi huò le) / 卖光了 (Mài guāng le)
spanish: A palabras necias, oídos sordos. / Ignora los comentarios tontos.
